Detailed Description

One or two dimensional collection of histograms.

Definition at line 16 of file HistogramCollection_t.hh.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

histmgr::HistogramCollection_t::HistogramCollection_t ( const std::string &  collection_name,
const EVENT::StringVec &  name_list,
UInt_t  n_hist,
const HistPar &  par 
) throw (std::bad_alloc, std::runtime_error) [inline]

Create a collection of histograms which will have the same binning and the same name (except of a numeric extension).

Parameters:
collection_name the of the histogram collection
name_list a vector containing the names of the histograms whose length is either equals n_hist or is zero. In the latter case the collection name is used for the all histograms.
n_hist the number of histograms to be created
par the binning of the histograms

The histograms are only written to a file if the histogram group, to which this histogram belongs, is assigned to a file (histmgr::HistMgr::assignFileName).

const HistPar &  par 
) [inline]

Create a collection of histograms which will have the same binning and the same name (except of a numeric extension).

Parameters:
collection_name the of the histogram collection
name_list a vector containing the names of the histograms whose length is either equals n_hist or is zero. In the latter case the collection name is used for the all histograms.
n_hist_list the number of histograms to be created
par the binning of the histogram
Returns:
pointer to the histogram collection

The histograms are only written to a file if the histogram group, to which this histogram belongs, is assigned to a file (histmgr::HistMgr::assignFileName).

Definition at line 57 of file HistogramCollection_t.hh.

References createHistograms().

histmgr::HistogramCollection_t::HistogramCollection_t ( lcio::LCCollection *  histograms,
lcio::IntVec *  indices 
) [inline]
Parameters:
histograms the linearised one or two dimensional collection of histograms
indices optional list of indicies used to give two dimensional access to the histogram list. for each possible index of the first dimension is needed which contains the offset in the list. The second index is added to this offset.

Definition at line 74 of file HistogramCollection_t.hh.

References _majorIndex.

histmgr::HistogramCollection_t::HistogramCollection_t ( lcio::LCCollection *  histograms  )  [inline]

Create a histogram collection from lcio collection.

Parameters:
histograms the linearised one or two dimensional collection of histograms (two dimensional collections have the collection parameter "major"). The method does not verify whether the lcio collection really is a histogram collection. However, if the collection has the parameter "major" it creates an index vector (costly operation) assuming that it is a 2d array instead of a 1d array(i.e. collection). The unique group id remains undedfined since it is not stored in the lcio collection.

Definition at line 98 of file HistogramCollection_t.hh.

References _majorIndex.

Member Function Documentation

const lcio::LCCollection* histmgr::HistogramCollection_t::collection (  )  const [inline]

get the collection of histograms (read only).

The index array needed for the two dimensional acces is added as a parameter named "major".

n_hist_list the number of histograms to be created

Returns:
